sentences.english: The design of the car has inspired many imitations.
sentences.chinese: 这辆轿车的设计引起了众多模仿。

sentences.english: This is why the modern Chinese politics becomes imitative politics.
sentences.chinese: 这使得中国现代政治成了“模仿的政治”。

sentences.english: The flexible Red Knife allows officers to rehearse responses to edged weapon attacks.
sentences.chinese: 柔性红刀可训练警官模仿在锐器袭击时反应。

sentences.english: In particular, my design employed mock objects to make testing easier.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是，我的设计利用了模仿对象来简化测试。

sentences.english: We think we don’t need to explain how paper and card textures are being used in web designing and give the design a very rough cut-and-paste and unpolished style.
sentences.chinese: 如何在网页中模仿纸张的质感无需我们赘述了。
回头他就表演套名人模仿秀。

sentences.english: The girl aped the way the movie star fixed her hair.
sentences.chinese: 这女孩子模仿影星的发式。

sentences.english: Studiesthe language is one kind of imitation.

sentences.chinese: 他滑稽地模仿那个政客的举止。

sentences.english: Its movements imitated the motion of five kinds of birds and beasts.
sentences.chinese: 其招式就模仿了五种飞禽走兽的动作。

sentences.english: The ape apes the ape-man in everything he does.
sentences.chinese: 大猩猩一切都模仿猿人。

sentences.english: Mary duplicated her mother's way of standing with her hands in her pockets.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽模仿她母亲两手插入口袋站立的样子。

sentences.english: The leg action of the breaststroke may have originated by imitating the swimming action of frogs.
sentences.chinese: 蛙泳中腿部蹬水的动作很可能是模仿青蛙的泳姿而来。

sentences.english: His early efforts to copy other famous stars at that time were a failure.
sentences.chinese: 他早期为模仿当时其他著名影星的努力均告失败。

sentences.english: All the services so fists can conduct their own simulconsumedd training.
sentences.chinese: 各军兵种都可以实行各自的模仿练习。

definition: lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
similar in expression and spirit/to bear a remarkable resemblance to
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
to be precisely the same/to be no different
